talks.title: Transparency in Innovation - Using Explainable AI (XAI) to Navigate Challenges in Drug Development
talks.description: Abstract for the conference talk: On average it takes 10 years to get a drug candidate from discovery to market. The hope is that AI could reduce that time by 50% while at the same time reducing costs. However, there are several potential ethical and practical considerations that must be addressed at every step of the process to maximise the benefits while minimising potential risks. While quality of data and biological complexity remain big hurdles, so does lack of transparency in a space where we need to understand why choices are made to reduce bias and improve innovation. As AI algorithms used in drug discovery are complex and difficult to interpret, researchers and regulators can struggle to understand how decisions are made and whether they are based on valid scientific principles. One solution is to explore Explainable AI (XAI) techniques that provide human-understandable explanations for model decisions. Using XAI model  methodologies we can get a deeper understanding of model behaviour, identify potential biases or errors, and make informed decisions about drug candidates, targets, and safety considerations, thus enhances transparency and promoting responsible and ethical AI-driven drug discovery.
talks.previewText: Discussing the use of Explainable AI in Drug Development

talks.title: The Genie in the Bottle: The Ethics of Generative AI
talks.description: Abstract for the conference talk: This talk delves into the ethical considerations surrounding generative AI exploring the profound implications of generative AI on society, individual rights, and ethical standards.
talks.previewText: Discussing the ethics of generative AI.

talks.title: Unlock your Linkedin potential: Tips and tricks to attract more recruiters
talks.description: Interactive webinar for Technigo, a coding bootcamp, fosuccing on providing handy tips and highlighting what you need to add to your Linkedin profile to get noticed as a career changer, someone who is new in the industry, or just curious. This session gave direct insights into a tech recruiter/ tech hiring manager's mind when looking at profiles
talks.previewText: Interactive webinar giving advice on what to highlight on your profile as a career changer

talks.title: Roundtable - Perfection vs Pragmatism
talks.previewText: Roundtable discussion as part of the The Live Series on the subject of Perfection vs Pragmatism in software development and is there a right or wrong choice ðŸ’¡
talks.description: As a software engineer, you will always find that some people want to perfect their craft, whilst others prioritize speed of delivery. So what makes people choose one or the other? Is there a right or wrong choice? In this episode, the panel discussed how they would describe themselves, has their approach changed since becoming a leader and if so, how?, and what would make them change their approach, among other things

talks.title: Internal Hackathons
talks.description: Organising and running internal hackathons at the companies I work at for improved internal collaboration and team building. These were cross functional hackathons with buisness, product, and engineering being invilved.
talks.previewText: Organised and ran internal hackathons for the companies I worked for

talks.title: Co Storm Mentor
talks.description: The concept behind CO-STORMâ„¢ is about how much more weâ€™re able to see (brainstorm) for each other than we see for ourselves. During these sessions, each participant had time for an introduction and a chance to discuss their most pressing pain point, project or idea in a safe and empowering environment. Mentors are assigned to a small group to brainstorm and help move ideas forward by asking questions, making suggestions, and offering advice.
talks.previewText: CO-STORMâ„¢ Mentors are assigned to a small group to help participants brainstorm and move ideas forward by asking questions, making suggestions, and offering advice.

talks.title: Intro to everything - building your first webpage
talks.description: Ran a workshop to introduce the concept of web development and start building a web page with HTML and CSS to beginners. The event started with an overview of web development, technologies, and career paths, and then began the hands on part where we built our first web pages together.
talks.previewText: Workshop to introduce the concept of web development and start building a web page with HTML and CSS

talks.title: Code and Career Mentor for junior developers coming into tech
talks.description: Individual mentoring for new or junior developers first coming into the industry. Mix of code and career mentoring. Regular sessions over 3-6 months with support between sessions if needed
talks.previewText: Mentoring for a number of people over the last few years

talks.title: Code Excursion Stockholm
talks.description: Code Excursion is a female coding school. It is a non-profit organisation for women to learn programming in a helpful, passionate and including way. Learn how to build websites, get into data science or touch on creative coding.
talks.previewText: Code Excursion is a female coding school running workshops for women to learn programming.
